items.title: Message chance program
items.body:
Hello I report a problem with Dexed v 0.9.6 in Ableton Live 10.
If you select a preset in Dexed after recording a track at each
 opening of the project Ableton Live signals that there have been
 changes in the project even if nothing has been changed, I think
 that Dexed sends a program change message every time the project
 is opened, if you select the default preset and save the project,
 no changes are reported when the project is reopened.
The program change message should only be sent if it is 
automated by Ableton and not always.

items.title: Host parameter randomization does not work (tested in Cakewalk)
items.body:
When clicking "randomize" in Cakewalk (load instrument, open GUI, click the dropdown-looking-thing on the top that says "VST3"), Dexed completely barfs up.

It changes to a random preset within the cart and will occasionally switch a few settings. (0.95 would reliably alter the envelope displays of operators 5 and 6, though it would not actually change the knob parameters - 0.96 seems less predictable).

However, the audio engine then becomes completely unresponsive - even clicking INIT will fail to produce audio from that Dexed instance.

This may be related to the automation issues in issue #277.

The old VST2 version of Dexed behaves properly.

items.title: Add MTS-ESP support
items.body:
For more info on MTS-ESP see https://oddsound.com/usingmtsesp.php and https://github.com/ODDSound/MTS-ESP.

MTS-ESP has been implemented in a number of synths already, including Surge, with which baconpaul was very helpful.  The implementation here in Dexed lets the SST tuning library take precedence, so if a user explicitly loads a .scl file it will use that.  If none is loaded it will follow the tuning from an MTS-ESP master plug-in instanced in the same session or, if there is none, automatically fall back to 12-TET.  All this is very low compute cost, so no overhead to worry about.

For any queries feel free to get in touch at info@odddound.com.

items.title: Improving documentation
items.body:
Hello,
Thanks for the amazing emulator! 
Would you be open to me making a PR with some inline documentation for the Mk1 engine code?
I've been going through the source code from the ground up in an effort to understand how the DX7 (maybe) works. I've written a bunch of documentation for the code as I go, this is mostly just clarifying what pieces of the code do. I think there may be a few minor inaccuracies in some of the variable names. Not anything serious, just things inherited from MSFA.

VST2 Mac build
items.body:
I'm in the process of moving my music production environment to a new machine (a Mac).  I have old projects that use the VST2 version of Dexed, and while the VST3 version of Dexed works fine for new projects, existing projects that use the VST2 version will raise a missing plugin error.  

I took a look at the linux VST2 build in the hopes it would be Mac compatible but it fails on the following step: 
``` ./scripts/projuce-lin-vst2.sh```
Error: 
```./scripts/projuce-lin-vst2.sh: line 13: assets/JUCE/Projucer: No such file or directory```

Is it possible to create a Mac-specific VST2 build for legacy purposes, or maybe tweak the linux version to be Mac compatible?  Thanks.

items.title: Some parameters not selectable in Ableton
items.body:
Hi there - apologies for the "this doesn't work in application X" sort of post, but I'm not knowledgable enough in VST dev so was hoping someone more experienced could help me flesh out this issue.

In Ableton you can "configure" a VST, which makes the parameters available to control outside of the VST's interface. This also lets you map those controls to MIDI. I'm pretty sure Dexed supports mapping controls to MIDI, but using Ableton in this case allows you to persist the settings.

During the "configure" process, you click on the VST controls and it adds them to the list of parameters. I've noticed that there are a few controls missing. For instance, on operator 2, the following controls can't be "configured":

- OP2 Tune
- OP2 Coarse tune
- OP2 EG Levels (1-4)
- OP2 Output level
- OP2 R Depth
- OP2 Mod sense
- OP2 Mode (fixed/ratio)

I'm running Windows 10, Dexed 1.9.5 with Ableton Live lite.

It's very possible this is user error, or an Ableton bug, however I saw similar problems on my (aging) Mac, which seemed to go away as soon as I used the AU instead of the VST, which made me wonder if it's related to #266.

If anyone thinks this is a problem with Dexed and not my setup, I'm happy to go and build a list of all of the parameters that need "fixed" - just let me know!

Thanks!

items.title: Program Change messages not working.
items.body:
I can't get Dexed to respond to program change messages. I'm only able to test the latest version in REAPER so not sure how localized this is.

From a blank REAPER project I've tried:

* Inserting a program change message in the clip and playing it
* Firing a program change message from the built-in script MIDI Program Change / Bank Switch on Load
* Firing a program change message from my own JSFX script

None of these has any effect on Dexed. I've confirmed that all these work with all the VSTis I regularly use (AAS stuff, Pianoteq) but Dexed seems to ignore them.

I wanted to take this opportunity to thank you for adding microtuning support. This is an absolutely huge deal for those of us who care about it, and it's enabled me to integrate Dexed back into my setup (hence this request...).

items.title: Envelope Generator.
items.body:
Pascal.
I finally understand the envelope generator and you're **_not going to like it_**.
I finally read Howard Massey technical explanation of the EG (Chapter 9)
The EG level starts at L4 not L1) This is how many patches sound notes one after another with some time in between.
It's also why the DX7 can have two attacks one aftet the other on a single keypress. It starts at L4 volume, travels down to L1 then backup to L2.
The key to getting this right is to understand that it is not really a ADSR (they have no volume vectors) and the final volume per segment is set by the operator, level. 
See if you can get hold of 'The complete DX7' by massey. Full of charts, graphs and envelopes explaining the this.

If you crack this, yours will be the only proper plug in the world.
Cheers.

items.title: Algorithms operator on / off display broken
items.body:
Hi All, displaying if operators are on or off in the algorithm display at the bottom of the UI seems to be broken. To reproduce, in Dexed 0.9.5 for macOS, do for example this:

1) start Dexed
2) turn operator 1 off, and see that the operator 1 still looks like it is on in the algorithm display
3) turn operator 1 back on, and see that operator 1 shows now as off in the algorithm display
4) use the mouse and click on 1 in the algorithm display, and the display will show the actual status as on

items.title: "tune" instead of "det" on macOS for the first encoder of each operator
items.body: Hi All. I am in the middle on some training that uses dexed, and my professor's dexed on Windows looks like in the video on the homepage: each operator's encoders are det, coarse and fine. But on dexed 0.9.5 for macOS I see tune, coarse and fine instead. The encoder also looks like it not doing anything but changing the display at the top (f = 1 +1/2/3...).

items.title: Context menu broken again on Mac?
items.body: Hi All, despite [this change back in 2017](https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/commit/d522d84d89e0017e442b19664cc2ceee5b42e337), I have no context menu in macOS today in dexed 0.9.5 . Is it just me? Thanks.

items.title: where can I find x86 dll?
items.body: I wanted to first thank you, this is a great vst and I´ve been using for almsot a year and I love it. I used to had the x86 version installed but accidently unninstalled it and now when I redownloaded it it´s only the x64 version. Now all my projects don´t match with the current version

items.title: [Feature request] StudioRack integration
items.body:
I'm the lead developer of an open-source VST plugin manager called StudioRack:
https://github.com/studiorack

The aim of my project is to provide a free open-source way to manage VST plugin dependencies and their versions. I would love to add Dexed to the StudioRack Registry, which would involve the following steps:

1. Publish a Github release containing the plugin source along with metadata plugins.json
2. Tag your Github repository with studiorack-plugin so it can be discovered
3. Wait for the studiorack-registry to index your plugin (every 24 hours)
4. Check the registry feed for your plugin to appear https://studiorack.github.io/studiorack-registry/

Wondering if you would be interested in collaborating to make this work? It would then allow users to install Dexed using the StudioRack website, command-line tool or app?

Thanks!

items.title: Missing file on installation
items.body:
Trying to use Dexed as a VST plugin in Ableton live standard. Each time I've tried to install, it is missing the ".dll" file that would  allow Ableton to read it. It's working fine as a standalone app, but the .dll is nowhere to be found. I have also been unable to find the file by itself anywhere on the internet. What could cause this, and how could it be fixed?

I am very new to coding, so I am unsure what could be going wrong. Every other VST I've downloaded has worked no problem.

Any help would be appreciated!

items.title: VST3 (.so file) do not appear in Plugin list Ardour Ubuntu 20.04
items.body: i have put .so file to my vst directory like my other plugin, rescanned, Ardour did not list dexed vst

items.title: How do I install on Ubuntu?
items.body:
Hi there. I couldn't find any documentation on how to install this on Linux.
The readme file only covers Windows and Mac installation.
Where do I put the 2 files that came in the linux zip file (Dexed and x86_64-linux) ?
The readme file said that there are 3 .sh files in a Scripts folder which wasn't included in the zip file. Only the 2 files I mentioned

items.title: Update the Surge Tuning Library
items.body:
We found a bug in our runing library in the rare case
where scale length and keyboard mapping lentgh mis-matched
where we could use the wrong ocrave count. Update the
tuning library to the latest version to pull fix.

items.title: Mod wheel not working.
items.body: Mod wheel non responsive when trying to add pitch modulation. Tried the same patch with the same settings on the stable build of Dexed. Works fine, but not in the latest build.

items.title: Ratio & Fixed switch bug.
items.body: In the recent VST3 release, switching from Ratio to Fixed and viceversa requires you to move the tuning knobs (tune, coarse, fine) for the frequency display to change. Otherwise it stays as the default setting (ie. f=1 when it should be displaying hertz instead)

items.title: Incomplete algorithms in Modern/OPL modes
items.body:
https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/blob/master/Source/msfa/fm_core.cc#L113

Algorithm 6 sounds exactly like algorithm 5 in modern/OPL mode because it doesn't calculate more than one operator in the feedback loop. Algorithm 4 is completely wrong too (3 operators in feedback loop). Mark I mode works because it has special case functions to calculate these ([2 ops fb](https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/blob/master/Source/EngineMkI.cpp#L207), [3 ops fb](https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/blob/master/Source/EngineMkI.cpp#L247)).

Bug report from here: https://www.kvraudio.com/forum/viewtopic.php?p=7847236#p7847236

items.title: DEXED for Windows and screen reader accessibility for blind users
items.body: Hi. I'm blind and rely on special software called a screen reader to access my computer. In simple terms, a screen reader speaks aloud the contents of the screen as the user navigates using the keyboard. I find that the DEXED VST plugin for Windows does not support screen readers nor keyboard navigation, from what I can tell. I don't need access to all the deep editing parameters because I can easily map those to physical controls on my MIDI controller, but I do need the ability to load cartridges and programs easily and I cannot figure out how to do this without being able to see the DEXED UI. Is there some way the program can be enhanced to allow blind users to load carts and programs? Even if there's a way I can open the Cartridges folder in Windows, right-click the cartridge I want and maybe have a "Load in DEXED" context menu option appear, for example. Thank you for any help/ideas.

items.title: Update get-juce.sh to use the latest JUCE version

The linux nightly build is broken on Ubuntu due to a JUCE Makefile error; the correct std version is not being set. 
Error: `unordered_map’ in namespace ‘std’ does not name a template type` which indicates the `std=c++17` compiler flag is not being correctly set. Manually bumping the version number from 6.0.0->6.0.1 fixes this.

items.title: Make scripts agnostic to invocation path
items.body:
A number of users attempting to build Dexed on linux have run into trouble, and developed various workarounds (#221 #225). It'd be nice if all the scripts worked no matter where they were run from, so that no matter how a user attempts to build them, they'll be successful.

To achieve that, this PR modifies each relevant install script to locate the absolute path of dexed (`DEXED_PATH`) and perform any actions relative to that.

### Testing

I've tested this on Linux, but I don't have the VST2 SDK, so I haven't tested `scripts/projuce-lin-vst2.sh`. I also don't have a Mac, so I haven't tested the mac scripts.

Shared scripts:
- [ ] set-version.sh (tested by author on Linux)
- [ ] release-notes.sh (tested by author on Linux)
- [ ] get-juce.sh (tested by author on Linux)
- [ ] build.sh (tested by author on Linux)

Linux scripts:
- [ ] projuce-lin.sh (tested by author on Linux)
- [ ] projuce-lin-vst2.sh
- [ ] build-lin.sh (tested by author on Linux)
- [ ] package-lin.sh (tested by author on Linux)

Mac scripts:
- [ ] projuce-mac.sh
- [ ] build-mac.sh
- [ ] build-mac-so.sh
- [ ] package-mac.sh

items.title: Changes to instructions to reflects changes to scripts
items.body:
For Linux to build successfully the current instructions cause errors. These were the steps I followed to successfully build the Standalone and VST

```
git clone https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed.git
cd dexed
git submodule update --init --recursive
cd scripts
./get-juce.sh
./projuce-lin.sh
./build-lin.sh
```

for VST2 too

```
git clone https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed.git
cd dexed
git submodule update --init --recursive
cd scripts
./get-juce.sh
export VST2SDK_DIR=~/path/to/vst2/sdk/dir
./projuce-lin-vst2.sh
./build-lin.sh

```

if the current instructions are followed modifications would be required in the scripts to reflect the location where the command is run from matches the locations defined in the scripts

items.title: feature request: adjustable parameter randomization
items.body:
Knowing, that Dexed is about an original reproduction of the DX7 engine i'd like to suggest an additional bit of editor functionality to the plugin:

Function: Adjustable randomization of all (probably the midi accessible) parameters/faders, eventually except the main volume.

Control: Second option after clicking INIT button would show options to either initialize as  implemented now, or altrenativly use a fader to randomize the current program 0-100%.

Luxurious option: Include an UNDO to be able to return to the original program quickly.

Possible gains: An adjustable randomization of the present sound/program would allow for slight changes and as well drastic surprises. This was always an inspiring function in the original editor software Voyetra Sideman DTX, which ran from 3 1/2" floppy disks on IBM PC in the late 80s or early 90s, allowing to "program" even a TX7 in an inspired manner and without an actual DX7 needed (besides direct parameter access of course). 

This is a musician's suggestion. Thank you for all you did already, Dexed is a wonder.

items.title: MPE, Tuning, Build and UI Tweaks
items.body:
Hi!

This pull request contains all of our changes in one pull request, with the commits broken out so you can see them as they progressed. If you would sooner I make one PR with one massive commit; or try and break it into multiple PRs; please let me know.

This change does quite a few things but the big picture breaks into four groups

1. Updates the build process so that you can easily use JUCE 5.4.7, build on all platforms, build the vst3 from a submodule, and build in azure pipelines (linux pipelines are disabled in this PR).

2. Implement SCL/KBM tuning in Dexed. Using the surge tuning library we implemented SCL/KBM support and tested it over a massive range of scales. This would close your https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/issues/74 if merged, I think.

3. Implement the beginning of MPE in Dexed. At this point we have MPE voice management and finding working, an MPE switch, and MPE pitch bend works. No responses to other MPE events (like channel AT or timbre) are in the synth. This would address but not close your https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/issues/176

4. A variety of UI tweaks including upping a couple of contrast points, adding lights to toggle switches, making the param screen properly non-modal, adding mouse wheel support. Basically some of the laundry list of things the team thought would be great.

Happy to discuss, modify, review, whatever you would like. We've tested these changes pretty carefully on mac windows and linux and, other than the final change I pushed today to close our issue 46, have been using this version of dexed regularly.

Thank you, and thanks for making such a great bit of kit.

items.title: Normalize every parameter, help needed (test sysex included)
items.body:
Hiya! Big fan of your project :)

While listening through some sysex-banks in Dexed I noticed that it's possible that out of range-values in sysex could f.ex. create distorted sounds and I wondered why I would find EG level-values of 127 when the maximum allowed is 99. I found that some parameters were not being checked/normalized and some that were (operator eg level etc), were being overwritten with the raw values afterwards ( https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/blob/02661e7551dcf4682c4b58124a524bcb57a562ba/Source/PluginData.cpp#L131 ).

I've been working on a fix for a pull request ( https://github.com/encore64/dexed/commits/NormalizeCorruptedSysex ) but I realized something - I don't know how the original Yamaha DX7 behaves in these cases as I don't own one anymore. Therefore I've made a test sysex-file. I would be thankful if anyone could try it on their DX7 and report back what the DX7 reports on these values.

[TestingLimits.zip](https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/files/4534107/TestingLimits.zip)

The first 3 voices are the testcase.

**1 INIT VOICE (valid "voice", has the maximum setting of these parameters):**
op1 eg rate / op1 eg level, p eg level / p eg rate = 99
op1 detune = 14
lfo wave = 5
transpose = 48

**2 INIT +1 (invalid "voice", increments 1 extra to these parameters**
op1 eg rate / op1 eg level, p eg level / p eg rate = 100
op1 detune = 15
lfo wave = 6
transpose = 49

**3 INIT MAX (invalid "voice", adds the maximum value to these parameters**
op1 eg rate / op1 eg level, p eg level / p eg rate = 127
op1 detune = 15
lfo wave = 7
transpose = 127

In Dexed these values will be shown when hovering over the parameters. I hope that the DX7 will show what it interprets these values as. Thanks in advance!

items.title: How would you like to handle dexed changes?
items.body:
Hi!

First, thanks for all your work on dexed. It is such a great sounding synth!

Over in the fork I mentioned in #201 I now have  complete SCL/KBM implementation working which matches pianotec and surge on all the scales we've tried. One item left to finish and make it a PR (which is to have an option to show the current tuning). Along the way I also upgraded some of the deprecation warnings, made the modal param dialog a bit better, and a few other things. I also relabeled the labels in #200 in the projucer file as opposed to the generated code. A bit of work to do before I package it as a PR against master but not much.

And that sort of has several of us over in surge land thinking: if we want to make a few larger changes to dexed (CI Infra, SCL/KBM, some UI improvements, and some MPE support are our rough list) would you rather we push them over to you as PRs (which means new builds and so on especially if you have a different CI infrastructure) or should we do a fork?

I am sort of reticent to do a fork, not for any legal reason (it's all GPL3 or Apache 2) but sort of for a social reason - to fork your product and add a bunch of features and not talk to you is just rude! But I'm also sort of reticent to be that guy who shows up with a bunch of PRs when you have this project running at a fairly low activity level on a stable beloved product. Speaking as an OSS owner, I can see both as being annoying!

Also some of our changes - like KBM/SCL support and MPE support - will mean dexed has features "bigger" than a DX7. You say in your readme if you add features "bigger" than a DX7 that should be a fork.

But open source works well when we all chat. You've made a wonderful bit of software. Over in surge team land we have some ideas for some concrete additions, and we have capacity to do them. Any thoughts on how you would like that to evolve?

And thanks again for all your work on dexed. It's great!

items.title: Continuous Integration and Build Infrastructure
items.body:
Hi!

First thanks for having a great FOSS synth available for us!

I'm one of the maintainers over on surge (https://surge-synthesizer.github.io) and with some of the other team members we were discussing some things about dexed which I am thinking of taking a look at (specifically: SCL/KBM support which I just finished fully in surge, where there's already issue #74 and maybe - though it would be much harder from looking at the code - think about MPE which is your issue #176). A lot of my SCL/KBM code could actually walk right over, it seems, and I've already been looking at Dx7Note. If you are amenable I can outline a plan over on #74 though.

But that's not the point of this issue. One of the absolute most useful things we did in surge was use microsoft's free azure pipelines to build a nightly on every push. We did this both for surge (not a JUCE product) and our surge FX standalone (which is a JUCE project).

Anyway I've made a fork of dexed and have set that up so that it does full continuous integration and has several other changes to the build pipeline. *It is absolutely not my intent to fork this project*. I just did the GitHub fork this morning and got it working, hence reaching out right away.

The changes I made look pretty big but they aren't. Here's what I did

1. I removed the Build and JuceLibraryCode from the repo
2. I added scripts to grab JUCE from the web and run the Projucer for us
3. I made the vst3sdk a git submodule
4. I added an azure pipeline which grabs juce, runs projucer, and builds the assets
5. This pipeline runs on all PRs against 'master' and 'bp-master' (I made a branch of master so I could keep my master in sync with yours)
6. When you push a PR to master (or bp-master) it runs the builds again and uploads the assets to a release on my github

I did a few other things which really helped with Surge also (like I set the dexed version to the git hash and date in the pipeline).

That means if I decide to make a change, the users who are working with me who don't have build capability can go ahead and just download a binary.

Anyway I'm writing this longer issue here because I did this this morning and I'm wondering if you would be interested in talking about ways to begin considering whether it was appropriate to merge. I certainly don't want to intrude on your project, but I love dexed and would love to be able to help with it, especially around things where I have already made a head-shaped divot in my desk figuring them out for surge.

Best!

items.title: Dexed does not handle (invalid) high bytes in sysex data gracefully
items.body:
There are quite a number of available sysex files online which have high bytes in the middle of their sysex data erroneously.  Typically this isn't garbled data, just data with the high bit set for no reason.  Dexed can't parse these correctly.  

I attach one example.  Consider the patch "SYNCLAVIER" (or as Dexed puts it "SY C  A VE R"), whose parameters (and name) Dexed interprets hillariously incorrectly.

This is an easy fix: Dexed just needs to strip out all high bits between the F0 and F7, then parse from there.

[BANK0054.SYX.zip](https://github.com/asb2m10/dexed/files/3796585/BANK0054.SYX.zip)

items.title: Add support for mapping controller RPNs and/or NRPNs to Dexed controls
items.body:
The CC mapping works well, but there aren't enough CCs to map all the individual controls (I am using a custom MIDI controller with *lots* of controls).
How easy would it be to add mapping support for RPNs or NRPNs instead of CCs ? There are hundreds of these available so each Dexed control could then be individually mapped.

items.title: DEXED Standalone App Crashes immediately after opening in macOS
items.body:
Hi,

I've recently encountered an issue with the standalone version of DEXED. Put simply, as soon as the app opens, it immediately shuts down again and I get the standard Ignore, Report or Reopen message from macOS.

I am running macOS 10.14.6 on a late 2013 27"iMac, 3.4GHz Intel Core i5, 32GB RAM.

I have tried uninstalling, reinstalling and nothing seems to work. The plugins both work fine, but the standalone refuses to play ball.

Any help or suggestions would be deeply appreciated. I have a TX7 module turning up in a couple of days and I'd really love to use DEXED with it.

Many thanks in advance,

Rob.
